item.title: I Am Sartana, Trade Your Guns for a Coffin
item.description: Sartana's Here… Trade Your Pistol for a Coffin is a 1970 spaghetti western that is the third of the Sartana film series with George Hilton taking over the lead role from Gianni Garko. The film was shot in Italy and directed by Giuliano Carnimeo.

item.title: White Fang and the Hunter
item.description: Zanna Bianca e il cacciatore solitario is a 1975 Italian adventure film directed by Alfonso Brescia. Despite the title tries to market the commercial success of Lucio Fulci's White Fang, the film's plot has no connection with the novel. The film was poorly received by critics, being defined as "pathetic" and marked as "trash", and gained some cult status in reason of its reputation.

item.title: Massacre Time
item.description: Massacre Time is a 1966 Italian Spaghetti Western film starring Franco Nero and George Hilton. The film was released in the United States originally as The Brute and the Beast.

item.title: The Longest Hunt
item.description: Spara, Gringo, spara is a 1968 Italian spaghetti western directed by Bruno Corbucci.

item.title: Shoot Twice
item.description: Shoot Twice is a 1969 Italian Western film directed by Nando Cicero and starring Klaus Kinski and Antonio Sabàto. The film is also known as Twice a Judas.
